DataElement.preferredDefinition: An explanation of why your menstrual cycle ended.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The reason the Menstrual Cycle involving regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization ends.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. The hormonal changes that lead up to a woman's having a period. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days.

Concepts.definition: The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)

Property.preferredDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)_The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (hiss-ter-EK-toe-mee) An operation in which the uterus is removed.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The answer is not known by the person answering.

Concepts.definition: The answer is not known by the person answering.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A description for something that exists in or is produced by nature, and is not artificial or man-made.: The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age.

Concepts.definition: A description for something that exists in or is produced by nature, and is not artificial or man-made.
The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
